intro: Prestonia quinquangularis, commonly known as the five-angled prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a woody vine characterized by its distinctive five-angled stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its aesthetic appeal.
